qas.question: In what decade was the ferry port built in Southampton to carry people to exotic destinations on the continent?
By what year did car ferries finish operating from Southampton, other than the one to the Isle of Wight?
What was built on the site where the Southampton Ferry Port used to be?
What has the Princess Alexandra Dock become?
What location that was once filled with passengers, dry docks, and trains is now a holding area for new cars?

context: Southampton used to be home to a number of ferry services to the continent, with destinations such as San Sebastian, Lisbon, Tangier and Casablanca. A ferry port was built during the <a0_0>1960s<a0_0/>. However, a number of these relocated to Portsmouth and by <a1_0>1996<a1_0/>, there were no longer any car ferries operating from Southampton with the exception of services to the Isle of Wight. The land used for Southampton Ferry Port was sold off and <a2_0>a retail and housing development<a2_0/> was built on the site. The Princess Alexandra Dock was converted into <a3_0>a marina<a3_0/>. Reception areas for new cars now fill the <a4_0>Eastern Docks<a4_0/> where passengers, dry docks and trains used to be.
